WRITING.TEXT: Jared's utter devotion to Richard is one of my favorite things about the show.
A lot of Enterprise level computers will have that sort of information displayed to make it easier to support them.

WRITING.TITLE: Mother's Day.
WRITING.TEXT:
I dreamed about my mom a lot after she died. It doesn't make any rational sense - nothing about the way she died was my fault - but I think I felt guilty about it. Losing her had been my biggest fear, and then it just happened out of nowhere. It began and ended with a call from my oldest brother in the middle of the night, and a mumbled "Mom's not here anymore," and then I spent the next five hours howling into my pillow waiting for the sun to rise.
I was twenty six. I wasn't ready to be an orphan. (Can you call yourself an orphan at 26? Does 'orphan' still apply to legal adults?)
Anyway, she was three weeks from retiring, and her health hadn't been great, but it hadn't been alarming, either. That didn't stop the dreams from dogging me. They started off pretty standard from what I've read up on a bunch of grief support forums: sometimes I would just see her, hang out with her a while. Once I dreamed that I walked in on her smoking on the back porch hooked to the house we had when I was growing up. She'd faked her death in that dream, and got really mad at me for "discovering" her and ruining her retirement.
The dreams kind of started going off the rails after that. Probably because I started sleeping more. My friends just assumed I was depressed, and that was probably part of it, but dreams were the only place that I could see her anymore. I mean, yeah. It hurt. It was like driving a thumb into a bruise. But I didn't have a lot of choice. I started to dream about finding her lost and wandering in the woods. I found her once drowned in a river like Ophelia, eyes wide open and milky white. Sometimes I dreamed that I had fallen into the past, and had called her up just to beg her to go to the hospital, to get her headache checked out. I love you, I love you, I love you, I repeated every time, just in case she wasn't sure, just because I knew I couldn't stop her from dying, and I was terrified that she would pass and somehow not know how much she meant to me.
I can't remember her voice when I'm awake. I can't remember what she looks like, either, unless I've got a photo to jump start the memories. But my recollection is perfect in my dreams. I spent a whole day with her once, just in my dreams, and I can remember the hug I gave her when I was saying goodbye, when I remembered that she was dead. We were the same height, but I can remember how fragile and delicate her arms felt when I pulled her against me. I can remember how her hair smelled. I told her goodbye, and I was crying, and she was crying, and she told me goodbye, too.
I remember that more vividly than any real hug I ever gave her.
I thought at first maybe that I'd finally found closure. That maybe this was enough, and that I could move on, but it wasn't, and I didn't, and the dreams didn't stop. Haven't stopped. She hides from me now, but my dreams are mine. Last night I found myself standing at her grave, and I ripped away the headstone and the dirt and the coffin lid with my hands. It shredded like cotton candy. She cowered when I found her, wraithlike and delicate, and I hugged her again. I love you, I love you, I love you, please don't forget that, I begged her, and she begged me to let her go. We cried together until I woke up.
But I'm only twenty eight. I'm not ready to be an orphan. Not yet.

I dunno, they've been pretty consistently over the top nutso since season one. I've been doing a rewatch and just got to the part where Richard washes his pants in the sink at Raviga before meeting with Peter and Jared just ... trades pants with him.

he messaged her because they have a mutual friend and said he wanted to go to a university that she listed that she had formerly attended. she said she didn't go there anymore and could not really help him with that school. he asked to add her anyway. she said she does not add people she doesn't know. he repeated that he wanted to add her anyway, so she asked why. that's the entire background.

he could have helped it by stopping when she asked him to :)
this guy isn't mentally ill or cognitively delayed, he's just pushy with little respect for the boundaries of people he's talking to. so, yeah, he does deserve it.

just as a general note to folks going "UGH WHY DIDNT SHE JUST BLOCK HIM IN THE FIRST PLACE"
she didn't because
* 1) they had a mutual friend,
* 2) he messaged her with the pretense of honest intentions (questions about a university she had previously attended), and
* 3) she is a good person who understands that folks sometimes have difficulty communicating with other people. she was willing to give him a shot and say "hey, those remarks aren't appropriate, please stop," because she is a teacher and a damn good one, and trying to course correcting idiots is kind of a reflex when you deal with college students all day.
sometimes it's easier to be nice than to have to worry about some dude flipping out and tagging your friends on his wall to call you an egotistical cunt for blocking him "for just saying hi."
lol he messaged her originally under the pretense of wanting information about a university she had attended that he claimed to want to visit.

nah girl who had the convo in the picture doesn't use reddit. she didn't block right away because they had a mutual friend and he messaged her originally under the pretense of asking questions about a university she had previously attended.
bread makes you fat??????

nah she's my pal. she's pretty hot and super put together, but the guy pretended to approach her with questions about a university she'd previously attended. she was trying to be polite because she understands that sometimes good people have difficulty communicating on the internet.
dude pushed it a lil far tho.
ok thanks

guy is blocked. thanks for assuming, tho.

Right, lmao! This happened to a friend of mine who tried to add her because they had a mutual friend, and he saw that she used to go to a university he wanted to attend. The pretense was "asking her questions about the school."
He asked her to friend him anyway, despite the fact that she no longer attends the school he wanted to ask questions about. She asked why, which is where the conversation picks up.

WRITING.TITLE: I gave my friend an old rat cage last night so he gave me a 3d printed grinder.
[Online][One-Shots][CST][Discord] Looking for folks to play through Grant Howitt's one-page oneshots with!
WRITING.TEXT:
Hey! I'm looking for folks who are interested in playing through some of Grant Howitt's one-shots (like [Honey Heist](http://i.imgur.com/rAZXBWb.jpg) and [Big Gay Orcs](https://i.imgur.com/n7D0tdl.jpg).) I'd to include some outgoing folks who aren't afraid to get into the zany kind of RP that these little systems seem to facilitate.
Please send me a PM if you're interested with a little bit of information about yourself. Plans would likely involve meeting online around 6PM CST on Saturday. Each 'game' would likely last a session or two. Depending on interest/how much fun the players are having, I'd be happy to either keep the same group or rotate new people in and out when we swap games.
